constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 104 (Tuesday, June 15, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. CARTER of Georgia:
H.R. 3896.
=========================== NOTE ===========================
June 15, 2021, on page H2817, in the Constitutional Authority
Statement section in the left-hand column, the following appeared:
By Mr CARTER of Georgia: H.R. 8896.
The online version has been corrected to read: By Mr CARTER of
Georgia: H.R. 3896.
========================= END NOTE =========================
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
The constitutional authority on which this bill rests is
the power of Congress to make rules for the government and
regulation of the land and naval forces, as enumerated in
Article I; Section 8, Clause 14 of the United States
Constitution.
[Page H2817]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

title: To direct the Secretary of Defense to submit to Congress a report on congressional increases to the budget of the Department of Defense for fiscal year 2023, and for other purposes.
